summary: A Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability was discovered in semver 7.5.0, a transitive dependency through ts-loader in the nyc-test-coverage package. The vulnerability allows untrusted user data to cause high availability impact, and was resolved when the vulnerable library was removed from the project.
userImpact: Users' builds and CI/CD pipelines could experience denial of service through malicious or untrusted semver range inputs.
rootCause: Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) in semver versions before 7.5.2 when parsing untrusted range data.
proposedFix: Upgrade semver to version 7.5.2 or later, or remove the vulnerable dependency chain.
resolutionDetails: The issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable library was removed from the Mend inventory for the specific branch.
keyQuote: Versions of the package semver before 7.5.2 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the function new Range
